lead_paragraph: HIRSCH--Charles S.,M.D. The trustees, faculty, and staff of NYU Langone Medical Center mourn the loss of Charles S. Hirsch, M.D. Over the course of his distinguished career, Dr. Hirsch made significant contributions as chair of the Department of Forensic Pathology at NYU School of Medicine and chief medical examiner of the city of New York for 25 years. He was best known for leading the chief medical examiner's office during the September 11, 2001, terrorist attacks and the massive effort to identify the deceased that followed. Dr. Hirsch was known as a visionary and dedicated public servant whose work earned him world renown, and helped make New York a global leader in how cities investigate unexpected deaths and help the family members left behind. We extend our heartfelt condolences to the Hirsch family. Kenneth G. Langone, Chair, Board of Trustees Robert I. Grossman, M.D., Dean and CEO 1/3
